paragraphs.title: Import Libraries
paragraphs.text:
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *

paragraphs.title: groupBy
paragraphs.text:
grp_cust = customer.groupBy("c_birth_year")
grp_cust.sum().show(5)
# More aggregate functions : count, sum, min, max, avg.

paragraphs.title: Aggregations : count, sum, max, min and avg
paragraphs.text:
grp_cust = customer.groupBy("c_birth_year").agg(
                                                count("c_customer_sk").alias("agg_count"), 
                                                sum("c_customer_sk").alias("sum"), 
                                                max("c_customer_sk").alias("max"),
                                                min("c_customer_sk").alias("min"),
                                                avg("c_customer_sk").alias("avg")).show()

paragraphs.title: Load Few more Tables
paragraphs.text:
tbl_name = "tpcds_orc_3000.Store_sales"
store_sales = spark.table(tbl_name)

tbl_name = "tpcds_orc_3000.Date_dim"
date_dim = spark.table(tbl_name)

paragraphs.title: Other Joins
paragraphs.text:
# df1.join(df2, on=None, how=None)
# how – str, default inner. Must be one of: inner, cross, outer, full, full_outer, left, left_outer, right, right_outer, left_semi, and left_anti.

paragraphs.title: save DataFrame as HIVE table
paragraphs.text:
date_dim.write.saveAsTable("training.date_dim_temp", mode = "overwrite")
# mode – one of append, overwrite, error, errorifexists, ignore (default: error)
# S3 Location : <warehouse_dir>/training.db

paragraphs.title: save DataFrame as HIVE table as Partition Table
paragraphs.text:
date_dim.write.saveAsTable("training.date_dim_temp_part", mode = "overwrite", partitionBy = ["d_year"])
# mode – one of append, overwrite, error, errorifexists, ignore (default: error)
# <warehouse_dir>/training.db/date_dim_temp_part

paragraphs.title: save DataFrame as HIVE External table
Write DataFrame as CSV
paragraphs.text: customer.select(c).write.csv(<PATH>), sep="|", header=True, mode="overwrite") # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to save csv file.

paragraphs.title: Create Data Frame from CSV - 1
paragraphs.text:
raw_data = spark.read.csv(<PATH>), sep="|", header=True)  # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to read csv file.
raw_data.show(5)

paragraphs.title: Create Data Frame from CSV - 2
paragraphs.text:
raw_data = spark.read.csv(<PATH>), sep="|", header=True, inferSchema=True) # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to read csv file.
raw_data.show(5)
# Note : it will scan all the records to infer the schema and will slowdown the data loading process.

paragraphs.title: Create Data Frame from CSV - 3
paragraphs.text:
raw_data = spark.read.csv(<PATH>), schema=schema, sep="|", header=True) # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to read csv file.
raw_data.show(5)

paragraphs.title: My SQL Endpoint and Password
paragraphs.text:
endpoint = <HOST:PORT> # TODO : Replace with your HOST and PORT Number.
password = <password> # TODO : Replace with your password.

paragraphs.title: read Data from mySQL
paragraphs.text:
url = 'jdbc:mysql://{0}/qubole'.format(endpoint)
mysql_df = spark.read.format('jdbc').options(
      url=url,
      driver='com.mysql.jdbc.Driver',
      dbtable= 'test',
      user='admin',
      password = password).load()

paragraphs.title: save Result to mySQL
paragraphs.text:
url = 'jdbc:mysql://{0}/qubole'.format(endpoint)
mysql_df.write.format('jdbc').options(
      url=url,
      driver='com.mysql.jdbc.Driver',
      dbtable= 'test',
      user='admin',
      password = password).mode('append').save()

paragraphs.title: Read Data From Parquet File
paragraphs.text:
df = spark.read.parquet(<PATH>) # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to read parquet file.
z.show(df)

paragraphs.title: Write Data to Parquet File
paragraphs.text: df.write.parquet(<PATH>), mode="overwrite") # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to write parquet file.

paragraphs.title: Write Data to Parquet File. Partition By Year
paragraphs.text: df.write.parquet(<PATH>), mode="overwrite", partitionBy='d_year') # TODO : Change "PATH" to the location where you would like to write parquet file.
